Independent media and civil society organizations: Independent media and civil society organizations play a critical role in holding governments accountable and putting pressure on them to address social grievances. 3. International diplomatic pressure: International actors, such as regional organizations, international NGOs, and foreign governments, can also pressure governments to take action. This can take the form of diplomatic pressure, economic sanctions, and other measures that signal support for democratic values and political change.

4. Citizen monitoring and observation: Citizen monitoring and observation of government actions can help to identify any malpractices or noncompliance with laws or regulations. International organizations could support citizen observation missions, which can help to ensure accountability and transparency in the political process.

Overall, the most effective way to pressure governments to take action is to engage in peaceful civic action, promote democratic values, and urge governments to engage in meaningful dialogue with citizens and civil society organizations.
